docs.lead_paragraph: "Page 29: Admission: Your health care will be rationed!"

headline.main: The Internet, Where Rumors Never Die

docs.abstract: A nonpartisan fact-checking organization weighs the allegations made in a widely distributed e-mail chain letter.
docs.snippet: A nonpartisan fact-checking organization weighs the allegations made in a widely distributed e-mail chain letter.

docs.lead_paragraph: Does the stock market want bipartisan health care legislation, or a Democrats-only version?

headline.main: Goldman Sachs Is Bullish on Bipartisanship

docs.abstract: Analyses by Goldman Sachs say that a bipartisan compromise on health care would be better for health stocks than a Democratic-driven approach.
docs.snippet: Analyses by Goldman Sachs say that a bipartisan compromise on health care would be better for health stocks than a Democratic-driven approach.

docs.lead_paragraph: While polls show support slipping for a health care overhaul, a new television advertisement, set to start running Friday in 12 states, tries to persuade middle-class families who already have health insurance that a change would be good for them.

headline.main: New Ad: 'Eight Ways' a Health Care Overhaul Will Help You

docs.abstract: A new television ad campaign by advocacy groups supporting a health care overhaul lists eight ways the effort could improve the system even for those who already have insurance.
docs.snippet: A new television ad campaign by advocacy groups supporting a health care overhaul lists eight ways the effort could improve the system even for those who already have insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated Florida Gov. Charlie Crist has chosen George LeMieux, his former chief of staff, as the interim senator replacing Republican Mel Martinez, who announced earlier this summer that he didn't intend to complete his term.

headline.main: Crist Names Ally as Senate Replacement for Martinez

docs.abstract: The Florida governor chooses a longtime political friend and former staff member as the interim senator until the election in 2010.
docs.snippet: The Florida governor chooses a longtime political friend and former staff member as the interim senator until the election in 2010.

docs.lead_paragraph: Uwe E. Reinhardt is an economics professor at Princeton.
docs.abstract: Can we afford health care reform? An economist discusses some of the lessons from the Medicare Modernization Act of 2003.
docs.snippet: Can we afford health care reform? An economist discusses some of the lessons from the Medicare Modernization Act of 2003.

docs.lead_paragraph: Times Square may not be anybody's idea of a town hall. But it will serve as the setting Saturday for Democratic and health-related groups that support President Obama's goals for overhauling the health care system.

headline.main: Saturday Health Care Rally at Times Square

docs.abstract: A health care rally set for Times Square on Saturday will include marchers demanding full insurance coverage for pregnancy.
docs.snippet: A health care rally set for Times Square on Saturday will include marchers demanding full insurance coverage for pregnancy.
